intro: Meliosma cundinamarcensis, commonly known as the Cundinamarca meliosma, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for cloud forest ecosystems.
